2664// List View control
2665int GuiListView(Rectangle bounds, const char *text, int *scrollIndex, int active)
2666{
2667 int itemCount = 0;
2668 const char **items = NULL;
2669
2670 if (text != NULL) items = GuiTextSplit(text, &itemCount, NULL);
2671
2672 return GuiListViewEx(bounds, items, itemCount, NULL, scrollIndex, active);
2673}
2674
2675// List View control with extended parameters
2676int GuiListViewEx(Rectangle bounds, const char **text, int count, int *focus, int *scrollIndex, int active)
2677{
2678 GuiState state = guiState;
2679 int itemFocused = (focus == NULL)? -1 : *focus;
2680 int itemSelected = active;
2681
2682 // Check if we need a scroll bar
2683 bool useScrollBar = false;
2684 if ((GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_HEIGHT) + GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_SPACING))*count > bounds.height) useScrollBar = true;
2685
2686 // Define base item rectangle [0]
2687 Rectangle itemBounds = { 0 };
2688 itemBounds.x = bounds.x + GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_SPACING);
2689 itemBounds.y = bounds.y + GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_SPACING) + GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, BORDER_WIDTH);
2690 itemBounds.width = bounds.width - 2*GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_SPACING) - GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, BORDER_WIDTH);
2691 itemBounds.height = (float)GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_HEIGHT);
2692 if (useScrollBar) itemBounds.width -= GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, SCROLLBAR_WIDTH);
2693
2694 // Get items on the list
2695 int visibleItems = (int)bounds.height/(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_HEIGHT) + GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_SPACING));
2696 if (visibleItems > count) visibleItems = count;
2697
2698 int startIndex = (scrollIndex == NULL)? 0 : *scrollIndex;
2699 if ((startIndex < 0) || (startIndex > (count - visibleItems))) startIndex = 0;
2700 int endIndex = startIndex + visibleItems;
2701
2702 // Update control
2703 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2704 if ((state != STATE_DISABLED) && !guiLocked)
2705 {
2706 Vector2 mousePoint = GetMousePosition();
2707
2708 // Check mouse inside list view
2709 if (CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, bounds))
2710 {
2711 state = STATE_FOCUSED;
2712
2713 // Check focused and selected item
2714 for (int i = 0; i < visibleItems; i++)
2715 {
2716 if (CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, itemBounds))
2717 {
2718 itemFocused = startIndex + i;
2719 if (IsMouseButtonPressed(MOUSE_LEFT_BUTTON))
2720 {
2721 if (itemSelected == (startIndex + i)) itemSelected = -1;
2722 else itemSelected = startIndex + i;
2723 }
2724 break;
2725 }
2726
2727 // Update item rectangle y position for next item
2728 itemBounds.y += (GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_HEIGHT) + GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_SPACING));
2729 }
2730
2731 if (useScrollBar)
2732 {
2733 int wheelMove = (int)GetMouseWheelMove();
2734 startIndex -= wheelMove;
2735
2736 if (startIndex < 0) startIndex = 0;
2737 else if (startIndex > (count - visibleItems)) startIndex = count - visibleItems;
2738
2739 endIndex = startIndex + visibleItems;
2740 if (endIndex > count) endIndex = count;
2741 }
2742 }
2743 else itemFocused = -1;
2744
2745 // Reset item rectangle y to [0]
2746 itemBounds.y = bounds.y + GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_SPACING) + GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, BORDER_WIDTH);
2747 }
2748 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2749
2750 // Draw control
2751 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2752 GuiDrawRectangle(bounds, GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, BORDER_WIDTH), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BORDER + state*3)), guiAlpha), GetColor(GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, BACKGROUND_COLOR))); // Draw background
2753
2754 // Draw visible items
2755 for (int i = 0; ((i < visibleItems) && (text != NULL)); i++)
2756 {
2757 if (state == STATE_DISABLED)
2758 {
2759 if ((startIndex + i) == itemSelected) GuiDrawRectangle(itemBounds, GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BORDER_WIDTH), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BORDER_COLOR_DISABLED)), guiAlpha), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BASE_COLOR_DISABLED)), guiAlpha));
2760
2761 GuiDrawText(text[startIndex + i], GetTextBounds(DEFAULT, itemBounds), GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, TEXT_ALIGNMENT), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, TEXT_COLOR_DISABLED)), guiAlpha));
2762 }
2763 else
2764 {
2765 if ((startIndex + i) == itemSelected)
2766 {
2767 // Draw item selected
2768 GuiDrawRectangle(itemBounds, GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BORDER_WIDTH), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BORDER_COLOR_PRESSED)), guiAlpha), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BASE_COLOR_PRESSED)), guiAlpha));
2769 GuiDrawText(text[startIndex + i], GetTextBounds(DEFAULT, itemBounds), GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, TEXT_ALIGNMENT), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, TEXT_COLOR_PRESSED)), guiAlpha));
2770 }
2771 else if ((startIndex + i) == itemFocused)
2772 {
2773 // Draw item focused
2774 GuiDrawRectangle(itemBounds, GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BORDER_WIDTH), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BORDER_COLOR_FOCUSED)), guiAlpha), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BASE_COLOR_FOCUSED)), guiAlpha));
2775 GuiDrawText(text[startIndex + i], GetTextBounds(DEFAULT, itemBounds), GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, TEXT_ALIGNMENT), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, TEXT_COLOR_FOCUSED)), guiAlpha));
2776 }
2777 else
2778 {
2779 // Draw item normal
2780 GuiDrawText(text[startIndex + i], GetTextBounds(DEFAULT, itemBounds), GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, TEXT_ALIGNMENT), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, TEXT_COLOR_NORMAL)), guiAlpha));
2781 }
2782 }
2783
2784 // Update item rectangle y position for next item
2785 itemBounds.y += (GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_HEIGHT) + GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, LIST_ITEMS_SPACING));
2786 }
2787
2788 if (useScrollBar)
2789 {
2790 Rectangle scrollBarBounds = {
2791 bounds.x + bounds.width - GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BORDER_WIDTH) - GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, SCROLLBAR_WIDTH),
2792 bounds.y + GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BORDER_WIDTH), (float)GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, SCROLLBAR_WIDTH),
2793 bounds.height - 2*GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, BORDER_WIDTH)
2794 };
2795
2796 // Calculate percentage of visible items and apply same percentage to scrollbar
2797 float percentVisible = (float)(endIndex - startIndex)/count;
2798 float sliderSize = bounds.height*percentVisible;
2799
2800 int prevSliderSize = GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SLIDER_SIZE); // Save default slider size
2801 int prevScrollSpeed = GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SPEED); // Save default scroll speed
2802 GuiSetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SLIDER_SIZE, (int)sliderSize); // Change slider size
2803 GuiSetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SPEED, count - visibleItems); // Change scroll speed
2804
2805 startIndex = GuiScrollBar(scrollBarBounds, startIndex, 0, count - visibleItems);
2806
2807 GuiSetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SPEED, prevScrollSpeed); // Reset scroll speed to default
2808 GuiSetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SLIDER_SIZE, prevSliderSize); // Reset slider size to default
2809 }
2810 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2811
2812 if (focus != NULL) *focus = itemFocused;
2813 if (scrollIndex != NULL) *scrollIndex = startIndex;
2814
2815 return itemSelected;
2816}
2817
2818// Color Panel control
2819Color GuiColorPanel(Rectangle bounds, const char *text, Color color)
2820{
2821 const Color colWhite = { 255, 255, 255, 255 };
2822 const Color colBlack = { 0, 0, 0, 255 };
2823
2824 GuiState state = guiState;
2825 Vector2 pickerSelector = { 0 };
2826
2827 Vector3 vcolor = { (float)color.r/255.0f, (float)color.g/255.0f, (float)color.b/255.0f };
2828 Vector3 hsv = ConvertRGBtoHSV(vcolor);
2829
2830 pickerSelector.x = bounds.x + (float)hsv.y*bounds.width; // HSV: Saturation
2831 pickerSelector.y = bounds.y + (1.0f - (float)hsv.z)*bounds.height; // HSV: Value
2832
2833 float hue = -1.0f;
2834 Vector3 maxHue = { hue >= 0.0f ? hue : hsv.x, 1.0f, 1.0f };
2835 Vector3 rgbHue = ConvertHSVtoRGB(maxHue);
2836 Color maxHueCol = { (unsigned char)(255.0f*rgbHue.x),
2837 (unsigned char)(255.0f*rgbHue.y),
2838 (unsigned char)(255.0f*rgbHue.z), 255 };
2839
2840 // Update control
2841 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2842 if ((state != STATE_DISABLED) && !guiLocked)
2843 {
2844 Vector2 mousePoint = GetMousePosition();
2845
2846 if (CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, bounds))
2847 {
2848 if (IsMouseButtonDown(MOUSE_LEFT_BUTTON))
2849 {
2850 state = STATE_PRESSED;
2851 pickerSelector = mousePoint;
2852
2853 // Calculate color from picker
2854 Vector2 colorPick = { pickerSelector.x - bounds.x, pickerSelector.y - bounds.y };
2855
2856 colorPick.x /= (float)bounds.width; // Get normalized value on x
2857 colorPick.y /= (float)bounds.height; // Get normalized value on y
2858
2859 hsv.y = colorPick.x;
2860 hsv.z = 1.0f - colorPick.y;
2861
2862 Vector3 rgb = ConvertHSVtoRGB(hsv);
2863
2864 // NOTE: Vector3ToColor() only available on raylib 1.8.1
2865 color = RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color){ (unsigned char)(255.0f*rgb.x),
2866 (unsigned char)(255.0f*rgb.y),
2867 (unsigned char)(255.0f*rgb.z),
2868 (unsigned char)(255.0f*(float)color.a/255.0f) };
2869
2870 }
2871 else state = STATE_FOCUSED;
2872 }
2873 }
2874 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2875
2876 // Draw control
2877 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2878 if (state != STATE_DISABLED)
2879 {
2880 DrawRectangleGradientEx(bounds, Fade(colWhite, guiAlpha), Fade(colWhite, guiAlpha), Fade(maxHueCol, guiAlpha), Fade(maxHueCol, guiAlpha));
2881 DrawRectangleGradientEx(bounds, Fade(colBlack, 0), Fade(colBlack, guiAlpha), Fade(colBlack, guiAlpha), Fade(colBlack, 0));
2882
2883 // Draw color picker: selector
2884 Rectangle selector = { pickerSelector.x - GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, COLOR_SELECTOR_SIZE)/2, pickerSelector.y - GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, COLOR_SELECTOR_SIZE)/2, (float)GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, COLOR_SELECTOR_SIZE), (float)GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, COLOR_SELECTOR_SIZE) };
2885 GuiDrawRectangle(selector, 0, BLANK, Fade(colWhite, guiAlpha));
2886 }
2887 else
2888 {
2889 DrawRectangleGradientEx(bounds, Fade(Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BASE_COLOR_DISABLED)), 0.1f), guiAlpha), Fade(Fade(colBlack, 0.6f), guiAlpha), Fade(Fade(colBlack, 0.6f), guiAlpha), Fade(Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER_COLOR_DISABLED)), 0.6f), guiAlpha));
2890 }
2891
2892 GuiDrawRectangle(bounds, GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER_WIDTH), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER + state*3)), guiAlpha), BLANK);
2893 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2894
2895 return color;
2896}

2898// Color Bar Alpha control
2899// NOTE: Returns alpha value normalized [0..1]
2900float GuiColorBarAlpha(Rectangle bounds, const char *text, float alpha)
2901{
2902 #if !defined(RAYGUI_COLORBARALPHA_CHECKED_SIZE)
2903 #define RAYGUI_COLORBARALPHA_CHECKED_SIZE 10
2904 #endif
2905
2906 GuiState state = guiState;
2907 Rectangle selector = { (float)bounds.x + alpha*bounds.width - GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_SELECTOR_HEIGHT)/2, (float)bounds.y - GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_SELECTOR_OVERFLOW), (float)GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_SELECTOR_HEIGHT), (float)bounds.height + GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_SELECTOR_OVERFLOW)*2 };
2908
2909 // Update control
2910 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2911 if ((state != STATE_DISABLED) && !guiLocked)
2912 {
2913 Vector2 mousePoint = GetMousePosition();
2914
2915 if (CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, bounds) ||
2916 CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, selector))
2917 {
2918 if (IsMouseButtonDown(MOUSE_LEFT_BUTTON))
2919 {
2920 state = STATE_PRESSED;
2921
2922 alpha = (mousePoint.x - bounds.x)/bounds.width;
2923 if (alpha <= 0.0f) alpha = 0.0f;
2924 if (alpha >= 1.0f) alpha = 1.0f;
2925 //selector.x = bounds.x + (int)(((alpha - 0)/(100 - 0))*(bounds.width - 2*GuiGetStyle(SLIDER, BORDER_WIDTH))) - selector.width/2;
2926 }
2927 else state = STATE_FOCUSED;
2928 }
2929 }
2930 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2931
2932 // Draw control
2933 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2934
2935 // Draw alpha bar: checked background
2936 if (state != STATE_DISABLED)
2937 {
2938 int checksX = (int)bounds.width/RAYGUI_COLORBARALPHA_CHECKED_SIZE;
2939 int checksY = (int)bounds.height/RAYGUI_COLORBARALPHA_CHECKED_SIZE;
2940
2941 for (int x = 0; x < checksX; x++)
2942 {
2943 for (int y = 0; y < checksY; y++)
2944 {
2945 Rectangle check = { bounds.x + x*RAYGUI_COLORBARALPHA_CHECKED_SIZE, bounds.y + y*RAYGUI_COLORBARALPHA_CHECKED_SIZE, RAYGUI_COLORBARALPHA_CHECKED_SIZE, RAYGUI_COLORBARALPHA_CHECKED_SIZE };
2946 GuiDrawRectangle(check, 0, BLANK, ((x + y)%2)? Fade(Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER_COLOR_DISABLED)), 0.4f), guiAlpha) : Fade(Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BASE_COLOR_DISABLED)), 0.4f), guiAlpha));
2947 }
2948 }
2949
2950 DrawRectangleGradientEx(bounds, RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color){ 255, 255, 255, 0 }, RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color){ 255, 255, 255, 0 }, Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color){ 0, 0, 0, 255 }, guiAlpha), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color){ 0, 0, 0, 255 }, guiAlpha));
2951 }
2952 else DrawRectangleGradientEx(bounds, Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BASE_COLOR_DISABLED)), 0.1f), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BASE_COLOR_DISABLED)), 0.1f), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER_COLOR_DISABLED)), guiAlpha), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER_COLOR_DISABLED)), guiAlpha));
2953
2954 GuiDrawRectangle(bounds, GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER_WIDTH), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER + state*3)), guiAlpha), BLANK);
2955
2956 // Draw alpha bar: selector
2957 GuiDrawRectangle(selector, 0, BLANK, Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER + state*3)), guiAlpha));
2958 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2959
2960 return alpha;
2961}

2963// Color Bar Hue control
2964// Returns hue value normalized [0..1]
2965// NOTE: Other similar bars (for reference):
2966// Color GuiColorBarSat() [WHITE->color]
2967// Color GuiColorBarValue() [BLACK->color], HSV/HSL
2968// float GuiColorBarLuminance() [BLACK->WHITE]
2969float GuiColorBarHue(Rectangle bounds, const char *text, float hue)
2970{
2971 GuiState state = guiState;
2972 Rectangle selector = { (float)bounds.x - GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_SELECTOR_OVERFLOW), (float)bounds.y + hue/360.0f*bounds.height - GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_SELECTOR_HEIGHT)/2, (float)bounds.width + GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_SELECTOR_OVERFLOW)*2, (float)GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_SELECTOR_HEIGHT) };
2973

2975 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
2976 if ((state != STATE_DISABLED) && !guiLocked)
2977 {
2978 Vector2 mousePoint = GetMousePosition();
2979
2980 if (CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, bounds) ||
2981 CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, selector))
2982 {
2983 if (IsMouseButtonDown(MOUSE_LEFT_BUTTON))
2984 {
2985 state = STATE_PRESSED;
2986
2987 hue = (mousePoint.y - bounds.y)*360/bounds.height;
2988 if (hue <= 0.0f) hue = 0.0f;
2989 if (hue >= 359.0f) hue = 359.0f;
2990
2991 }
2992 else state = STATE_FOCUSED;
2993
2994 /*if (IsKeyDown(KEY_UP))
2995 {
2996 hue -= 2.0f;
2997 if (hue <= 0.0f) hue = 0.0f;
2998 }
2999 else if (IsKeyDown(KEY_DOWN))
3000 {
3001 hue += 2.0f;
3002 if (hue >= 360.0f) hue = 360.0f;
3003 }*/
3004 }
3005 }
3006 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
3007
3008 // Draw control
3009 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
3010 if (state != STATE_DISABLED)
3011 {
3012 // Draw hue bar:color bars
3013 DrawRectangleGradientV((int)bounds.x, (int)(bounds.y), (int)bounds.width, (int)ceilf(bounds.height/6), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color) { 255, 0, 0, 255 }, guiAlpha), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color) { 255, 255, 0, 255 }, guiAlpha));
3014 DrawRectangleGradientV((int)bounds.x, (int)(bounds.y + bounds.height/6), (int)bounds.width, (int)ceilf(bounds.height/6), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color) { 255, 255, 0, 255 }, guiAlpha), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color) { 0, 255, 0, 255 }, guiAlpha));
3015 DrawRectangleGradientV((int)bounds.x, (int)(bounds.y + 2*(bounds.height/6)), (int)bounds.width, (int)ceilf(bounds.height/6), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color) { 0, 255, 0, 255 }, guiAlpha), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color) { 0, 255, 255, 255 }, guiAlpha));
3016 DrawRectangleGradientV((int)bounds.x, (int)(bounds.y + 3*(bounds.height/6)), (int)bounds.width, (int)ceilf(bounds.height/6), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color) { 0, 255, 255, 255 }, guiAlpha), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color) { 0, 0, 255, 255 }, guiAlpha));
3017 DrawRectangleGradientV((int)bounds.x, (int)(bounds.y + 4*(bounds.height/6)), (int)bounds.width, (int)ceilf(bounds.height/6), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color) { 0, 0, 255, 255 }, guiAlpha), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color) { 255, 0, 255, 255 }, guiAlpha));
3018 DrawRectangleGradientV((int)bounds.x, (int)(bounds.y + 5*(bounds.height/6)), (int)bounds.width, (int)(bounds.height/6), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color) { 255, 0, 255, 255 }, guiAlpha), Fade(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color) { 255, 0, 0, 255 }, guiAlpha));
3019 }
3020 else DrawRectangleGradientV((int)bounds.x, (int)bounds.y, (int)bounds.width, (int)bounds.height, Fade(Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BASE_COLOR_DISABLED)), 0.1f), guiAlpha), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER_COLOR_DISABLED)), guiAlpha));
3021
3022 GuiDrawRectangle(bounds, GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER_WIDTH), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER + state*3)), guiAlpha), BLANK);
3023
3024 // Draw hue bar: selector
3025 GuiDrawRectangle(selector, 0, BLANK, Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BORDER + state*3)), guiAlpha));
3026 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
3027
3028 return hue;
3029}

3031// Color Picker control
3032// NOTE: It's divided in multiple controls:
3033// Color GuiColorPanel(Rectangle bounds, Color color)
3034// float GuiColorBarAlpha(Rectangle bounds, float alpha)
3035// float GuiColorBarHue(Rectangle bounds, float value)
3036// NOTE: bounds define GuiColorPanel() size
3037Color GuiColorPicker(Rectangle bounds, const char *text, Color color)
3038{
3039 color = GuiColorPanel(bounds, NULL, color);
3040
3041 Rectangle boundsHue = { (float)bounds.x + bounds.width + GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_PADDING), (float)bounds.y, (float)GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_WIDTH), (float)bounds.height };
3042 //Rectangle boundsAlpha = { bounds.x, bounds.y + bounds.height + GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BARS_PADDING), bounds.width, GuiGetStyle(COLORPICKER, BARS_THICK) };
3043
3044 Vector3 hsv = ConvertRGBtoHSV(RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Vector3){ color.r/255.0f, color.g/255.0f, color.b/255.0f });
3045 hsv.x = GuiColorBarHue(boundsHue, NULL, hsv.x);
3046 //color.a = (unsigned char)(GuiColorBarAlpha(boundsAlpha, (float)color.a/255.0f)*255.0f);
3047 Vector3 rgb = ConvertHSVtoRGB(hsv);
3048
3049 color = RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Color){ (unsigned char)roundf(rgb.x*255.0f), (unsigned char)roundf(rgb.y*255.0f), (unsigned char)roundf(rgb.z*255.0f), color.a };
3050
3051 return color;
3052}

3072 buttonBounds.height = RAYGUI_MESSAGEBOX_BUTTON_HEIGHT;

3093

3095 {

3097 buttonBounds.x += (buttonBounds.width + RAYGUI_MESSAGEBOX_BUTTON_PADDING);

3100 GuiSetStyle(BUTTON, TEXT_ALIGNMENT, prevTextAlignment);
3101 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
3102

3194
3195// Grid control
3196// NOTE: Returns grid mouse-hover selected cell
3197// About drawing lines at subpixel spacing, simple put, not easy solution:
3198// https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4435450/2d-opengl-drawing-lines-that-dont-exactly-fit-pixel-raster
3199Vector2 GuiGrid(Rectangle bounds, const char *text, float spacing, int subdivs)
3200{
3201 // Grid lines alpha amount
3202 #if !defined(RAYGUI_GRID_ALPHA)
3203 #define RAYGUI_GRID_ALPHA 0.15f
3204 #endif
3205
3206 GuiState state = guiState;
3207 Vector2 mousePoint = GetMousePosition();
3208 Vector2 currentCell = { -1, -1 };
3209
3210 int linesV = ((int)(bounds.width/spacing))*subdivs + 1;
3211 int linesH = ((int)(bounds.height/spacing))*subdivs + 1;
3212
3213 // Update control
3214 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
3215 if ((state != STATE_DISABLED) && !guiLocked)
3216 {
3217 if (CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, bounds))
3218 {
3219 // NOTE: Cell values must be rounded to int
3220 currentCell.x = (int)((mousePoint.x - bounds.x)/spacing);
3221 currentCell.y = (int)((mousePoint.y - bounds.y)/spacing);
3222 }
3223 }
3224 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
3225
3226 // Draw control
3227 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
3228
3229 // TODO: Draw background panel?
3230
3231 switch (state)
3232 {
3233 case STATE_NORMAL:
3234 {
3235 if (subdivs > 0)
3236 {
3237 // Draw vertical grid lines
3238 for (int i = 0; i < linesV; i++)
3239 {
3240 Rectangle lineV = { bounds.x + spacing*i/subdivs, bounds.y, 1, bounds.height };
3241 GuiDrawRectangle(lineV, 0, BLANK, ((i%subdivs) == 0) ? Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, LINE_COLOR)), RAYGUI_GRID_ALPHA*4) : Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, LINE_COLOR)), RAYGUI_GRID_ALPHA));
3242 }
3243
3244 // Draw horizontal grid lines
3245 for (int i = 0; i < linesH; i++)
3246 {
3247 Rectangle lineH = { bounds.x, bounds.y + spacing*i/subdivs, bounds.width, 1 };
3248 GuiDrawRectangle(lineH, 0, BLANK, ((i%subdivs) == 0) ? Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, LINE_COLOR)), RAYGUI_GRID_ALPHA*4) : Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, LINE_COLOR)), RAYGUI_GRID_ALPHA));
3249 }
3250 }
3251 } break;
3252 default: break;
3253 }
3254
3255 return currentCell;
3256}
3257
3258//----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3259// Styles loading functions
3260//----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3261
3262// Load raygui style file (.rgs)
3263// NOTE: By default a binary file is expected, that file could contain a custom font,
3264// in that case, custom font image atlas is GRAY+ALPHA and pixel data can be compressed (DEFLATE)
3265void GuiLoadStyle(const char *fileName)
3266{
3267 #define MAX_LINE_BUFFER_SIZE 256
3268
3269 bool tryBinary = false;
3270
3271 // Try reading the files as text file first
3272 FILE *rgsFile = fopen(fileName, "rt");
3273
3274 if (rgsFile != NULL)
3275 {
3276 char buffer[MAX_LINE_BUFFER_SIZE] = { 0 };
3277 fgets(buffer, MAX_LINE_BUFFER_SIZE, rgsFile);
3278
3279 if (buffer[0] == '#')
3280 {
3281 int controlId = 0;
3282 int propertyId = 0;
3283 unsigned int propertyValue = 0;
3284
3285 while (!feof(rgsFile))
3286 {
3287 switch (buffer[0])
3288 {
3289 case 'p':
3290 {
3291 // Style property: p <control_id> <property_id> <property_value> <property_name>
3292
3293 sscanf(buffer, "p %d %d 0x%x", &controlId, &propertyId, &propertyValue);
3294 GuiSetStyle(controlId, propertyId, (int)propertyValue);
3295
3296 } break;
3297 case 'f':
3298 {
3299 // Style font: f <gen_font_size> <charmap_file> <font_file>
3300
3301 int fontSize = 0;
3302 char charmapFileName[256] = { 0 };
3303 char fontFileName[256] = { 0 };
3304 sscanf(buffer, "f %d %s %[^\r\n]s", &fontSize, charmapFileName, fontFileName);
3305
3306 Font font = { 0 };
3307
3308 if (charmapFileName[0] != '0')
3309 {
3310 // Load characters from charmap file,
3311 // expected '\n' separated list of integer values
3312 char *charValues = LoadFileText(charmapFileName);
3313 if (charValues != NULL)
3314 {
3315 int glyphCount = 0;
3316 const char **chars = TextSplit(charValues, '\n', &glyphCount);
3317
3318 int *values = (int *)RAYGUI_MALLOC(glyphCount*sizeof(int));
3319 for (int i = 0; i < glyphCount; i++) values[i] = TextToInteger(chars[i]);
3320
3321 if (font.texture.id != GetFontDefault().texture.id) UnloadTexture(font.texture);
3322 font = LoadFontEx(TextFormat("%s/%s", GetDirectoryPath(fileName), fontFileName), fontSize, values, glyphCount);
3323 if (font.texture.id == 0) font = GetFontDefault();
3324
3325 RAYGUI_FREE(values);
3326 }
3327 }
3328 else
3329 {
3330 if (font.texture.id != GetFontDefault().texture.id) UnloadTexture(font.texture);
3331 font = LoadFontEx(TextFormat("%s/%s", GetDirectoryPath(fileName), fontFileName), fontSize, NULL, 0);
3332 if (font.texture.id == 0) font = GetFontDefault();
3333 }
3334
3335 if ((font.texture.id > 0) && (font.glyphCount > 0)) GuiSetFont(font);
3336
3337 } break;
3338 default: break;
3339 }
3340
3341 fgets(buffer, MAX_LINE_BUFFER_SIZE, rgsFile);
3342 }
3343 }
3344 else tryBinary = true;
3345
3346 fclose(rgsFile);
3347 }
3348
3349 if (tryBinary)
3350 {
3351 rgsFile = fopen(fileName, "rb");
3352
3353 if (rgsFile == NULL) return;
3354
3355 char signature[5] = { 0 };
3356 short version = 0;
3357 short reserved = 0;
3358 int propertyCount = 0;
3359
3360 fread(signature, 1, 4, rgsFile);
3361 fread(&version, 1, sizeof(short), rgsFile);
3362 fread(&reserved, 1, sizeof(short), rgsFile);
3363 fread(&propertyCount, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3364
3365 if ((signature[0] == 'r') &&
3366 (signature[1] == 'G') &&
3367 (signature[2] == 'S') &&
3368 (signature[3] == ' '))
3369 {
3370 short controlId = 0;
3371 short propertyId = 0;
3372 unsigned int propertyValue = 0;
3373
3374 for (int i = 0; i < propertyCount; i++)
3375 {
3376 fread(&controlId, 1, sizeof(short), rgsFile);
3377 fread(&propertyId, 1, sizeof(short), rgsFile);
3378 fread(&propertyValue, 1, sizeof(unsigned int), rgsFile);
3379
3380 if (controlId == 0) // DEFAULT control
3381 {
3382 // If a DEFAULT property is loaded, it is propagated to all controls
3383 // NOTE: All DEFAULT properties should be defined first in the file
3384 GuiSetStyle(0, (int)propertyId, propertyValue);
3385
3386 if (propertyId < RAYGUI_MAX_PROPS_BASE) for (int i = 1; i < RAYGUI_MAX_CONTROLS; i++) GuiSetStyle(i, (int)propertyId, propertyValue);
3387 }
3388 else GuiSetStyle((int)controlId, (int)propertyId, propertyValue);
3389 }
3390
3391 // Font loading is highly dependant on raylib API to load font data and image
3392#if !defined(RAYGUI_STANDALONE)
3393 // Load custom font if available
3394 int fontDataSize = 0;
3395 fread(&fontDataSize, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3396
3397 if (fontDataSize > 0)
3398 {
3399 Font font = { 0 };
3400 int fontType = 0; // 0-Normal, 1-SDF
3401 Rectangle whiteRec = { 0 };
3402
3403 fread(&font.baseSize, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3404 fread(&font.glyphCount, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3405 fread(&fontType, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3406
3407 // Load font white rectangle
3408 fread(&whiteRec, 1, sizeof(Rectangle), rgsFile);
3409
3410 // Load font image parameters
3411 int fontImageUncompSize = 0;
3412 int fontImageCompSize = 0;
3413 fread(&fontImageUncompSize, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3414 fread(&fontImageCompSize, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3415
3416 Image imFont = { 0 };
3417 imFont.mipmaps = 1;
3418 fread(&imFont.width, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3419 fread(&imFont.height, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3420 fread(&imFont.format, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3421
3422 if (fontImageCompSize < fontImageUncompSize)
3423 {
3424 // Compressed font atlas image data (DEFLATE), it requires DecompressData()
3425 int dataUncompSize = 0;
3426 unsigned char *compData = (unsigned char *)RAYGUI_MALLOC(fontImageCompSize);
3427 fread(compData, 1, fontImageCompSize, rgsFile);
3428 imFont.data = DecompressData(compData, fontImageCompSize, &dataUncompSize);
3429
3430 // Security check, dataUncompSize must match the provided fontImageUncompSize
3431 if (dataUncompSize != fontImageUncompSize) RAYGUI_LOG("WARNING: Uncompressed font atlas image data could be corrupted");
3432
3433 RAYGUI_FREE(compData);
3434 }
3435 else
3436 {
3437 // Font atlas image data is not compressed
3438 imFont.data = (unsigned char *)RAYGUI_MALLOC(fontImageUncompSize);
3439 fread(imFont.data, 1, fontImageUncompSize, rgsFile);
3440 }
3441
3442 if (font.texture.id != GetFontDefault().texture.id) UnloadTexture(font.texture);
3443 font.texture = LoadTextureFromImage(imFont);
3444 if (font.texture.id == 0) font = GetFontDefault();
3445
3446 RAYGUI_FREE(imFont.data);
3447
3448 // Load font recs data
3449 font.recs = (Rectangle *)RAYGUI_CALLOC(font.glyphCount, sizeof(Rectangle));
3450 for (int i = 0; i < font.glyphCount; i++) fread(&font.recs[i], 1, sizeof(Rectangle), rgsFile);
3451
3452 // Load font chars info data
3453 font.glyphs = (GlyphInfo *)RAYGUI_CALLOC(font.glyphCount, sizeof(GlyphInfo));
3454 for (int i = 0; i < font.glyphCount; i++)
3455 {
3456 fread(&font.glyphs[i].value, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3457 fread(&font.glyphs[i].offsetX, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3458 fread(&font.glyphs[i].offsetY, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3459 fread(&font.glyphs[i].advanceX, 1, sizeof(int), rgsFile);
3460 }
3461
3462 GuiSetFont(font);
3463
3464 // Set font texture source rectangle to be used as white texture to draw shapes
3465 // NOTE: This way, all gui can be draw using a single draw call
3466 if ((whiteRec.width != 0) && (whiteRec.height != 0)) SetShapesTexture(font.texture, whiteRec);
3467 }
3468#endif
3469 }
3470
3471 fclose(rgsFile);
3472 }
3473}
3474

3476void GuiLoadStyleDefault(void)
3477{
3478 // We set this variable first to avoid cyclic function calls
3479 // when calling GuiSetStyle() and GuiGetStyle()
3480 guiStyleLoaded = true;
3481

3544 GuiSetStyle(LISTVIEW, SCROLLBAR_SIDE, SCROLLBAR_RIGHT_SIDE);
3545 GuiSetStyle(COLORPICKER, COLOR_SELECTOR_SIZE, 8);
3546 GuiSetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_WIDTH, 16);
3547 GuiSetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_PADDING, 8);
3548 GuiSetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_SELECTOR_HEIGHT, 8);
3549 GuiSetStyle(COLORPICKER, HUEBAR_SELECTOR_OVERFLOW, 2);
3550
3551 guiFont = GetFontDefault(); // Initialize default font
3552}
3553
3554// Get text with icon id prepended
3555// NOTE: Useful to add icons by name id (enum) instead of
3556// a number that can change between ricon versions
3557const char *GuiIconText(int iconId, const char *text)
3558{
3559#if defined(RAYGUI_NO_ICONS)
3560 return NULL;
3561#else
3562 static char buffer[1024] = { 0 };
3563 static char iconBuffer[6] = { 0 };
3564
3565 if (text != NULL)
3566 {
3567 memset(buffer, 0, 1024);
3568 sprintf(buffer, "#%03i#", iconId);
3569
3570 for (int i = 5; i < 1024; i++)
3571 {
3572 buffer[i] = text[i - 5];
3573 if (text[i - 5] == '\0') break;
3574 }
3575
3576 return buffer;
3577 }
3578 else
3579 {
3580 sprintf(iconBuffer, "#%03i#", iconId & 0x1ff);
3581
3582 return iconBuffer;
3583 }
3584#endif
3585}
3586
3587#if !defined(RAYGUI_NO_ICONS)
3588
3589// Get full icons data pointer
3590unsigned int *GuiGetIcons(void) { return guiIcons; }
3591
3592// Load raygui icons file (.rgi)
3593// NOTE: In case nameIds are required, they can be requested with loadIconsName,
3594// they are returned as a guiIconsName[iconCount][RAYGUI_ICON_MAX_NAME_LENGTH],
3595// WARNING: guiIconsName[]][] memory should be manually freed!
3596char **GuiLoadIcons(const char *fileName, bool loadIconsName)
3597{
3598 // Style File Structure (.rgi)
3599 // ------------------------------------------------------
3600 // Offset | Size | Type | Description
3601 // ------------------------------------------------------
3602 // 0 | 4 | char | Signature: "rGI "
3603 // 4 | 2 | short | Version: 100
3604 // 6 | 2 | short | reserved
3605
3606 // 8 | 2 | short | Num icons (N)
3607 // 10 | 2 | short | Icons size (Options: 16, 32, 64) (S)
3608
3609 // Icons name id (32 bytes per name id)
3610 // foreach (icon)
3611 // {
3612 // 12+32*i | 32 | char | Icon NameId
3613 // }
3614
3615 // Icons data: One bit per pixel, stored as unsigned int array (depends on icon size)
3616 // S*S pixels/32bit per unsigned int = K unsigned int per icon
3617 // foreach (icon)
3618 // {
3619 // ... | K | unsigned int | Icon Data
3620 // }
3621
3622 FILE *rgiFile = fopen(fileName, "rb");
3623
3624 char **guiIconsName = NULL;
3625
3626 if (rgiFile != NULL)
3627 {
3628 char signature[5] = { 0 };
3629 short version = 0;
3630 short reserved = 0;
3631 short iconCount = 0;
3632 short iconSize = 0;
3633
3634 fread(signature, 1, 4, rgiFile);
3635 fread(&version, 1, sizeof(short), rgiFile);
3636 fread(&reserved, 1, sizeof(short), rgiFile);
3637 fread(&iconCount, 1, sizeof(short), rgiFile);
3638 fread(&iconSize, 1, sizeof(short), rgiFile);
3639
3640 if ((signature[0] == 'r') &&
3641 (signature[1] == 'G') &&
3642 (signature[2] == 'I') &&
3643 (signature[3] == ' '))
3644 {
3645 if (loadIconsName)
3646 {
3647 guiIconsName = (char **)RAYGUI_MALLOC(iconCount*sizeof(char **));
3648 for (int i = 0; i < iconCount; i++)
3649 {
3650 guiIconsName[i] = (char *)RAYGUI_MALLOC(RAYGUI_ICON_MAX_NAME_LENGTH);
3651 fread(guiIconsName[i], RAYGUI_ICON_MAX_NAME_LENGTH, 1, rgiFile);
3652 }
3653 }
3654 else fseek(rgiFile, iconCount*RAYGUI_ICON_MAX_NAME_LENGTH, SEEK_CUR);
3655
3656 // Read icons data directly over guiIcons data array
3657 fread(guiIcons, iconCount*(iconSize*iconSize/32), sizeof(unsigned int), rgiFile);
3658 }
3659
3660 fclose(rgiFile);
3661 }
3662
3663 return guiIconsName;
3664}
3665
3666// Draw selected icon using rectangles pixel-by-pixel
3667void GuiDrawIcon(int iconId, int posX, int posY, int pixelSize, Color color)
3668{
3669 #define BIT_CHECK(a,b) ((a) & (1u<<(b)))
3670
3671 for (int i = 0, y = 0; i < RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE*RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE/32; i++)
3672 {
3673 for (int k = 0; k < 32; k++)
3674 {
3675 if (BIT_CHECK(guiIcons[iconId*RAYGUI_ICON_DATA_ELEMENTS + i], k))
3676 {
3677 #if !defined(RAYGUI_STANDALONE)
3678 DrawRectangle(posX + (k%RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE)*pixelSize, posY + y*pixelSize, pixelSize, pixelSize, color);
3679 #endif
3680 }
3681
3682 if ((k == 15) || (k == 31)) y++;
3683 }
3684 }
3685}
3686
3687// Get icon bit data
3688// NOTE: Bit data array grouped as unsigned int (RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE*RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE/32 elements)
3689unsigned int *GuiGetIconData(int iconId)
3690{
3691 static unsigned int iconData[RAYGUI_ICON_DATA_ELEMENTS] = { 0 };
3692 memset(iconData, 0, RAYGUI_ICON_DATA_ELEMENTS*sizeof(unsigned int));
3693
3694 if (iconId < RAYGUI_ICON_MAX_ICONS) memcpy(iconData, &guiIcons[iconId*RAYGUI_ICON_DATA_ELEMENTS], RAYGUI_ICON_DATA_ELEMENTS*sizeof(unsigned int));
3695
3696 return iconData;
3697}
3698
3699// Set icon bit data
3700// NOTE: Data must be provided as unsigned int array (RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE*RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE/32 elements)
3701void GuiSetIconData(int iconId, unsigned int *data)
3702{
3703 if (iconId < RAYGUI_ICON_MAX_ICONS) memcpy(&guiIcons[iconId*RAYGUI_ICON_DATA_ELEMENTS], data, RAYGUI_ICON_DATA_ELEMENTS*sizeof(unsigned int));
3704}

3706// Set icon scale (1 by default)
3707void GuiSetIconScale(unsigned int scale)
3708{
3709 guiIconScale = (scale < 1)? 1 : scale;
3710}
3711
3712// Set icon pixel value
3713void GuiSetIconPixel(int iconId, int x, int y)
3714{
3715 #define BIT_SET(a,b) ((a) |= (1u<<(b)))
3716
3717 // This logic works for any RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE pixels icons,
3718 // For example, in case of 16x16 pixels, every 2 lines fit in one unsigned int data element
3719 BIT_SET(guiIcons[iconId*RAYGUI_ICON_DATA_ELEMENTS + y/(sizeof(unsigned int)*8/RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE)], x + (y%(sizeof(unsigned int)*8/RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE)*RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE));
3720}
3721
3722// Clear icon pixel value
3723void GuiClearIconPixel(int iconId, int x, int y)
3724{
3725 #define BIT_CLEAR(a,b) ((a) &= ~((1u)<<(b)))
3726
3727 // This logic works for any RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE pixels icons,
3728 // For example, in case of 16x16 pixels, every 2 lines fit in one unsigned int data element
3729 BIT_CLEAR(guiIcons[iconId*RAYGUI_ICON_DATA_ELEMENTS + y/(sizeof(unsigned int)*8/RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE)], x + (y%(sizeof(unsigned int)*8/RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE)*RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE));
3730}
3731
3732// Check icon pixel value
3733bool GuiCheckIconPixel(int iconId, int x, int y)
3734{
3735 #define BIT_CHECK(a,b) ((a) & (1u<<(b)))
3736
3737 return (BIT_CHECK(guiIcons[iconId*8 + y/2], x + (y%2*16)));
3738}
3739#endif // !RAYGUI_NO_ICONS

3741//----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3742// Module specific Functions Definition
3743//----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3744// Gui get text width considering icon
3745static int GetTextWidth(const char *text)
3746{
3747 #if !defined(ICON_TEXT_PADDING)
3748 #define ICON_TEXT_PADDING 4
3749 #endif
3750
3751 Vector2 size = { 0 };
3752 int textIconOffset = 0;
3753
3754 if ((text != NULL) && (text[0] != '\0'))
3755 {
3756 if (text[0] == '#')
3757 {
3758 for (int i = 1; (text[i] != '\0') && (i < 5); i++)
3759 {
3760 if (text[i] == '#')
3761 {
3762 textIconOffset = i;
3763 break;
3764 }
3765 }
3766 }
3767
3768 // Make sure guiFont is set, GuiGetStyle() initializes it lazynessly
3769 float fontSize = (float)GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, TEXT_SIZE);
3770
3771 size = MeasureTextEx(guiFont, text + textIconOffset, fontSize, (float)GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, TEXT_SPACING));
3772 if (textIconOffset > 0) size.x += (RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE - ICON_TEXT_PADDING);
3773 }
3774
3775 return (int)size.x;
3776}
3777
3778// Get text bounds considering control bounds
3779static Rectangle GetTextBounds(int control, Rectangle bounds)
3780{
3781 Rectangle textBounds = bounds;
3782
3783 textBounds.x = bounds.x + GuiGetStyle(control, BORDER_WIDTH);
3784 textBounds.y = bounds.y + GuiGetStyle(control, BORDER_WIDTH);
3785 textBounds.width = bounds.width - 2*GuiGetStyle(control, BORDER_WIDTH);
3786 textBounds.height = bounds.height - 2*GuiGetStyle(control, BORDER_WIDTH);
3787
3788 // Consider TEXT_PADDING properly, depends on control type and TEXT_ALIGNMENT
3789 switch (control)
3790 {
3791 case COMBOBOX: bounds.width -= (GuiGetStyle(control, COMBO_BUTTON_WIDTH) + GuiGetStyle(control, COMBO_BUTTON_SPACING)); break;
3792 case VALUEBOX: break; // NOTE: ValueBox text value always centered, text padding applies to label
3793 default:
3794 {
3795 if (GuiGetStyle(control, TEXT_ALIGNMENT) == TEXT_ALIGN_RIGHT) textBounds.x -= GuiGetStyle(control, TEXT_PADDING);
3796 else textBounds.x += GuiGetStyle(control, TEXT_PADDING);
3797 textBounds.width -= 2 * GuiGetStyle(control, TEXT_PADDING);
3798 }
3799 break;
3800 }
3801
3802 // TODO: Special cases (no label): COMBOBOX, DROPDOWNBOX, LISTVIEW (scrollbar?)
3803 // More special cases (label on side): CHECKBOX, SLIDER, VALUEBOX, SPINNER
3804
3805 return textBounds;
3806}
3807
3808// Get text icon if provided and move text cursor
3809// NOTE: We support up to 999 values for iconId
3810static const char *GetTextIcon(const char *text, int *iconId)
3811{
3812#if !defined(RAYGUI_NO_ICONS)
3813 *iconId = -1;
3814 if (text[0] == '#') // Maybe we have an icon!
3815 {
3816 char iconValue[4] = { 0 }; // Maximum length for icon value: 3 digits + '\0'
3817
3818 int pos = 1;
3819 while ((pos < 4) && (text[pos] >= '0') && (text[pos] <= '9'))
3820 {
3821 iconValue[pos - 1] = text[pos];
3822 pos++;
3823 }
3824
3825 if (text[pos] == '#')
3826 {
3827 *iconId = TextToInteger(iconValue);
3828
3829 // Move text pointer after icon
3830 // WARNING: If only icon provided, it could point to EOL character: '\0'
3831 if (*iconId >= 0) text += (pos + 1);
3832 }
3833 }
3834#endif
3835
3836 return text;
3837}
3838
3839// Gui draw text using default font
3840static void GuiDrawText(const char *text, Rectangle bounds, int alignment, Color tint)
3841{
3842 #define TEXT_VALIGN_PIXEL_OFFSET(h) ((int)h%2) // Vertical alignment for pixel perfect
3843
3844 #if !defined(ICON_TEXT_PADDING)
3845 #define ICON_TEXT_PADDING 4
3846 #endif
3847
3848 if ((text != NULL) && (text[0] != '\0'))
3849 {
3850 int iconId = 0;
3851 text = GetTextIcon(text, &iconId); // Check text for icon and move cursor
3852
3853 // Get text position depending on alignment and iconId
3854 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3855 Vector2 position = { bounds.x, bounds.y };
3856
3857 // NOTE: We get text size after icon has been processed
3858 // TODO: REVIEW: We consider text size in case of line breaks! -> MeasureTextEx() depends on raylib!
3859 Vector2 textSize = MeasureTextEx(GuiGetFont(), text, GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, TEXT_SIZE), GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, TEXT_SPACING));
3860 //int textWidth = GetTextWidth(text);
3861 //int textHeight = GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, TEXT_SIZE);
3862
3863 // If text requires an icon, add size to measure
3864 if (iconId >= 0)
3865 {
3866 textSize.x += RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE*guiIconScale;
3867
3868 // WARNING: If only icon provided, text could be pointing to EOF character: '\0'
3869 if ((text != NULL) && (text[0] != '\0')) textSize.x += ICON_TEXT_PADDING;
3870 }
3871
3872 // Check guiTextAlign global variables
3873 switch (alignment)
3874 {
3875 case TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT:
3876 {
3877 position.x = bounds.x;
3878 position.y = bounds.y + bounds.height/2 - textSize.y/2 + TEXT_VALIGN_PIXEL_OFFSET(bounds.height);
3879 } break;
3880 case TEXT_ALIGN_CENTER:
3881 {
3882 position.x = bounds.x + bounds.width/2 - textSize.x/2;
3883 position.y = bounds.y + bounds.height/2 - textSize.y/2 + TEXT_VALIGN_PIXEL_OFFSET(bounds.height);
3884 } break;
3885 case TEXT_ALIGN_RIGHT:
3886 {
3887 position.x = bounds.x + bounds.width - textSize.x;
3888 position.y = bounds.y + bounds.height/2 - textSize.y/2 + TEXT_VALIGN_PIXEL_OFFSET(bounds.height);
3889 } break;
3890 default: break;
3891 }
3892
3893 // NOTE: Make sure we get pixel-perfect coordinates,
3894 // In case of decimals we got weird text positioning
3895 position.x = (float)((int)position.x);
3896 position.y = (float)((int)position.y);
3897 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3898
3899 // Draw text (with icon if available)
3900 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3901#if !defined(RAYGUI_NO_ICONS)
3902 if (iconId >= 0)
3903 {
3904 // NOTE: We consider icon height, probably different than text size
3905 GuiDrawIcon(iconId, (int)position.x, (int)(bounds.y + bounds.height/2 - RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE*guiIconScale/2 + TEXT_VALIGN_PIXEL_OFFSET(bounds.height)), guiIconScale, tint);
3906 position.x += (RAYGUI_ICON_SIZE*guiIconScale + ICON_TEXT_PADDING);
3907 }
3908#endif
3909 DrawTextEx(guiFont, text, position, (float)GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, TEXT_SIZE), (float)GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, TEXT_SPACING), tint);
3910 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3911 }
3912}

3914// Gui draw rectangle using default raygui plain style with borders
3915static void GuiDrawRectangle(Rectangle rec, int borderWidth, Color borderColor, Color color)
3916{
3917 if (color.a > 0)
3918 {
3919 // Draw rectangle filled with color
3920 DrawRectangle((int)rec.x, (int)rec.y, (int)rec.width, (int)rec.height, color);
3921 }
3922
3923 if (borderWidth > 0)
3924 {
3925 // Draw rectangle border lines with color
3926 DrawRectangle((int)rec.x, (int)rec.y, (int)rec.width, borderWidth, borderColor);
3927 DrawRectangle((int)rec.x, (int)rec.y + borderWidth, borderWidth, (int)rec.height - 2*borderWidth, borderColor);
3928 DrawRectangle((int)rec.x + (int)rec.width - borderWidth, (int)rec.y + borderWidth, borderWidth, (int)rec.height - 2*borderWidth, borderColor);
3929 DrawRectangle((int)rec.x, (int)rec.y + (int)rec.height - borderWidth, (int)rec.width, borderWidth, borderColor);
3930 }
3931}
3932
3933// Split controls text into multiple strings
3934// Also check for multiple columns (required by GuiToggleGroup())
3935static const char **GuiTextSplit(const char *text, int *count, int *textRow)
3936{
3937 // NOTE: Current implementation returns a copy of the provided string with '\0' (string end delimiter)
3938 // inserted between strings defined by "delimiter" parameter. No memory is dynamically allocated,
3939 // all used memory is static... it has some limitations:
3940 // 1. Maximum number of possible split strings is set by RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_ITEMS
3941 // 2. Maximum size of text to split is RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_TEXT_SIZE
3942 // NOTE: Those definitions could be externally provided if required
3943
3944 #if !defined(RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_ITEMS)
3945 #define RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_ITEMS 128
3946 #endif
3947 #if !defined(RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_TEXT_SIZE)
3948 #define RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_TEXT_SIZE 1024
3949 #endif
3950
3951 static const char *result[RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_ITEMS] = { NULL };
3952 static char buffer[RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_TEXT_SIZE] = { 0 };
3953 memset(buffer, 0, RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_TEXT_SIZE);
3954
3955 result[0] = buffer;
3956 int counter = 1;
3957
3958 if (textRow != NULL) textRow[0] = 0;
3959
3960 // Count how many substrings we have on text and point to every one
3961 for (int i = 0; i < RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_TEXT_SIZE; i++)
3962 {
3963 buffer[i] = text[i];
3964 if (buffer[i] == '\0') break;
3965 else if ((buffer[i] == ';') || (buffer[i] == '\n'))
3966 {
3967 result[counter] = buffer + i + 1;
3968
3969 if (textRow != NULL)
3970 {
3971 if (buffer[i] == '\n') textRow[counter] = textRow[counter - 1] + 1;
3972 else textRow[counter] = textRow[counter - 1];
3973 }
3974
3975 buffer[i] = '\0'; // Set an end of string at this point
3976
3977 counter++;
3978 if (counter == RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_ITEMS) break;
3979 }
3980 }
3981
3982 *count = counter;
3983
3984 return result;
3985}
3986
3987// Convert color data from RGB to HSV
3988// NOTE: Color data should be passed normalized
3989static Vector3 ConvertRGBtoHSV(Vector3 rgb)
3990{
3991 Vector3 hsv = { 0 };
3992 float min = 0.0f;
3993 float max = 0.0f;
3994 float delta = 0.0f;
3995
3996 min = (rgb.x < rgb.y)? rgb.x : rgb.y;
3997 min = (min < rgb.z)? min : rgb.z;
3998
3999 max = (rgb.x > rgb.y)? rgb.x : rgb.y;
4000 max = (max > rgb.z)? max : rgb.z;
4001
4002 hsv.z = max; // Value
4003 delta = max - min;
4004
4005 if (delta < 0.00001f)
4006 {
4007 hsv.y = 0.0f;
4008 hsv.x = 0.0f; // Undefined, maybe NAN?
4009 return hsv;
4010 }
4011
4012 if (max > 0.0f)
4013 {
4014 // NOTE: If max is 0, this divide would cause a crash
4015 hsv.y = (delta/max); // Saturation
4016 }
4017 else
4018 {
4019 // NOTE: If max is 0, then r = g = b = 0, s = 0, h is undefined
4020 hsv.y = 0.0f;
4021 hsv.x = 0.0f; // Undefined, maybe NAN?
4022 return hsv;
4023 }
4024
4025 // NOTE: Comparing float values could not work properly
4026 if (rgb.x >= max) hsv.x = (rgb.y - rgb.z)/delta; // Between yellow & magenta
4027 else
4028 {
4029 if (rgb.y >= max) hsv.x = 2.0f + (rgb.z - rgb.x)/delta; // Between cyan & yellow
4030 else hsv.x = 4.0f + (rgb.x - rgb.y)/delta; // Between magenta & cyan
4031 }
4032
4033 hsv.x *= 60.0f; // Convert to degrees
4034
4035 if (hsv.x < 0.0f) hsv.x += 360.0f;
4036
4037 return hsv;
4038}
4039
4040// Convert color data from HSV to RGB
4041// NOTE: Color data should be passed normalized
4042static Vector3 ConvertHSVtoRGB(Vector3 hsv)
4043{
4044 Vector3 rgb = { 0 };
4045 float hh = 0.0f, p = 0.0f, q = 0.0f, t = 0.0f, ff = 0.0f;
4046 long i = 0;
4047
4048 // NOTE: Comparing float values could not work properly
4049 if (hsv.y <= 0.0f)
4050 {
4051 rgb.x = hsv.z;
4052 rgb.y = hsv.z;
4053 rgb.z = hsv.z;
4054 return rgb;
4055 }
4056
4057 hh = hsv.x;
4058 if (hh >= 360.0f) hh = 0.0f;
4059 hh /= 60.0f;
4060
4061 i = (long)hh;
4062 ff = hh - i;
4063 p = hsv.z*(1.0f - hsv.y);
4064 q = hsv.z*(1.0f - (hsv.y*ff));
4065 t = hsv.z*(1.0f - (hsv.y*(1.0f - ff)));
4066
4067 switch (i)
4068 {
4069 case 0:
4070 {
4071 rgb.x = hsv.z;
4072 rgb.y = t;
4073 rgb.z = p;
4074 } break;
4075 case 1:
4076 {
4077 rgb.x = q;
4078 rgb.y = hsv.z;
4079 rgb.z = p;
4080 } break;
4081 case 2:
4082 {
4083 rgb.x = p;
4084 rgb.y = hsv.z;
4085 rgb.z = t;
4086 } break;
4087 case 3:
4088 {
4089 rgb.x = p;
4090 rgb.y = q;
4091 rgb.z = hsv.z;
4092 } break;
4093 case 4:
4094 {
4095 rgb.x = t;
4096 rgb.y = p;
4097 rgb.z = hsv.z;
4098 } break;
4099 case 5:
4100 default:
4101 {
4102 rgb.x = hsv.z;
4103 rgb.y = p;
4104 rgb.z = q;
4105 } break;
4106 }
4107
4108 return rgb;
4109}
4110
4111// Scroll bar control (used by GuiScrollPanel())
4112static int GuiScrollBar(Rectangle bounds, int value, int minValue, int maxValue)
4113{
4114 GuiState state = guiState;
4115
4116 // Is the scrollbar horizontal or vertical?
4117 bool isVertical = (bounds.width > bounds.height) ? false : true;
4118
4119 // The size (width or height depending on scrollbar type) of the spinner buttons
4120 const int spinnerSize = GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, ARROWS_VISIBLE) ? (isVertical ? (int)bounds.width - 2*GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH) : (int)bounds.height - 2*GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH)) : 0;
4121
4122 // Arrow buttons [<] [>] [∧] [∨]
4123 Rectangle arrowUpLeft = { 0 };
4124 Rectangle arrowDownRight = { 0 };
4125
4126 // Actual area of the scrollbar excluding the arrow buttons
4127 Rectangle scrollbar = { 0 };
4128
4129 // Slider bar that moves --[///]-----
4130 Rectangle slider = { 0 };
4131
4132 // Normalize value
4133 if (value > maxValue) value = maxValue;
4134 if (value < minValue) value = minValue;
4135
4136 const int range = maxValue - minValue;
4137 int sliderSize = GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SLIDER_SIZE);
4138
4139 // Calculate rectangles for all of the components
4140 arrowUpLeft = RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Rectangle) { (float)bounds.x + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH), (float)bounds.y + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH), (float)spinnerSize, (float)spinnerSize };
4141
4142 if (isVertical)
4143 {
4144 arrowDownRight = RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Rectangle) { (float)bounds.x + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH), (float)bounds.y + bounds.height - spinnerSize - GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH), (float)spinnerSize, (float)spinnerSize };
4145 scrollbar = RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Rectangle) { bounds.x + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH) + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_PADDING), arrowUpLeft.y + arrowUpLeft.height, bounds.width - 2*(GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH) + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_PADDING)), bounds.height - arrowUpLeft.height - arrowDownRight.height - 2*GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH) };
4146 sliderSize = (sliderSize >= scrollbar.height) ? ((int)scrollbar.height - 2) : sliderSize; // Make sure the slider won't get outside of the scrollbar
4147 slider = RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Rectangle) { (float)bounds.x + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH) + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SLIDER_PADDING), (float)scrollbar.y + (int)(((float)(value - minValue)/range)*(scrollbar.height - sliderSize)), (float)bounds.width - 2*(GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH) + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SLIDER_PADDING)), (float)sliderSize };
4148 }
4149 else
4150 {
4151 arrowDownRight = RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Rectangle) { (float)bounds.x + bounds.width - spinnerSize - GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH), (float)bounds.y + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH), (float)spinnerSize, (float)spinnerSize };
4152 scrollbar = RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Rectangle) { arrowUpLeft.x + arrowUpLeft.width, bounds.y + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH) + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_PADDING), bounds.width - arrowUpLeft.width - arrowDownRight.width - 2*GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH), bounds.height - 2*(GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH) + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_PADDING)) };
4153 sliderSize = (sliderSize >= scrollbar.width) ? ((int)scrollbar.width - 2) : sliderSize; // Make sure the slider won't get outside of the scrollbar
4154 slider = RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Rectangle) { (float)scrollbar.x + (int)(((float)(value - minValue)/range)*(scrollbar.width - sliderSize)), (float)bounds.y + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH) + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SLIDER_PADDING), (float)sliderSize, (float)bounds.height - 2*(GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH) + GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SLIDER_PADDING)) };
4155 }
4156
4157 // Update control
4158 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
4159 if ((state != STATE_DISABLED) && !guiLocked)
4160 {
4161 Vector2 mousePoint = GetMousePosition();
4162
4163 if (CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, bounds))
4164 {
4165 state = STATE_FOCUSED;
4166
4167 // Handle mouse wheel
4168 int wheel = (int)GetMouseWheelMove();
4169 if (wheel != 0) value += wheel;
4170
4171 if (IsMouseButtonPressed(MOUSE_LEFT_BUTTON))
4172 {
4173 if (CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, arrowUpLeft)) value -= range/GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SPEED);
4174 else if (CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, arrowDownRight)) value += range/GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, SCROLL_SPEED);
4175
4176 state = STATE_PRESSED;
4177 }
4178 else if (IsMouseButtonDown(MOUSE_LEFT_BUTTON))
4179 {
4180 if (!isVertical)
4181 {
4182 Rectangle scrollArea = { arrowUpLeft.x + arrowUpLeft.width, arrowUpLeft.y, scrollbar.width, bounds.height - 2*GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH) };
4183 if (CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, scrollArea)) value = (int)(((float)(mousePoint.x - scrollArea.x - slider.width/2)*range)/(scrollArea.width - slider.width) + minValue);
4184 }
4185 else
4186 {
4187 Rectangle scrollArea = { arrowUpLeft.x, arrowUpLeft.y+arrowUpLeft.height, bounds.width - 2*GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH), scrollbar.height };
4188 if (CheckCollisionPointRec(mousePoint, scrollArea)) value = (int)(((float)(mousePoint.y - scrollArea.y - slider.height/2)*range)/(scrollArea.height - slider.height) + minValue);
4189 }
4190 }
4191 }
4192
4193 // Normalize value
4194 if (value > maxValue) value = maxValue;
4195 if (value < minValue) value = minValue;
4196 }
4197 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
4198
4199 // Draw control
4200 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
4201 GuiDrawRectangle(bounds, GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, BORDER_WIDTH), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(LISTVIEW, BORDER + state*3)), guiAlpha), Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(DEFAULT, BORDER_COLOR_DISABLED)), guiAlpha)); // Draw the background
4202
4203 GuiDrawRectangle(scrollbar, 0, BLANK, Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(BUTTON, BASE_COLOR_NORMAL)), guiAlpha)); // Draw the scrollbar active area background
4204 GuiDrawRectangle(slider, 0, BLANK, Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(SLIDER, BORDER + state*3)), guiAlpha)); // Draw the slider bar
4205
4206 // Draw arrows (using icon if available)
4207 if (GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, ARROWS_VISIBLE))
4208 {
4209#if defined(RAYGUI_NO_ICONS)
4210 GuiDrawText(isVertical ? "^" : "<", RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Rectangle){ arrowUpLeft.x, arrowUpLeft.y, isVertical ? bounds.width : bounds.height, isVertical ? bounds.width : bounds.height },
4211 TEXT_ALIGN_CENTER, Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(DROPDOWNBOX, TEXT + (state*3))), guiAlpha));
4212 GuiDrawText(isVertical ? "v" : ">", RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Rectangle){ arrowDownRight.x, arrowDownRight.y, isVertical ? bounds.width : bounds.height, isVertical ? bounds.width : bounds.height },
4213 TEXT_ALIGN_CENTER, Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(DROPDOWNBOX, TEXT + (state*3))), guiAlpha));
4214#else
4215 GuiDrawText(isVertical ? "#121#" : "#118#", RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Rectangle){ arrowUpLeft.x, arrowUpLeft.y, isVertical ? bounds.width : bounds.height, isVertical ? bounds.width : bounds.height },
4216 TEXT_ALIGN_CENTER, Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, TEXT + state*3)), guiAlpha)); // ICON_ARROW_UP_FILL / ICON_ARROW_LEFT_FILL
4217 GuiDrawText(isVertical ? "#120#" : "#119#", RAYGUI_CLITERAL(Rectangle){ arrowDownRight.x, arrowDownRight.y, isVertical ? bounds.width : bounds.height, isVertical ? bounds.width : bounds.height },
4218 TEXT_ALIGN_CENTER, Fade(GetColor(GuiGetStyle(SCROLLBAR, TEXT + state*3)), guiAlpha)); // ICON_ARROW_DOWN_FILL / ICON_ARROW_RIGHT_FILL
4219#endif
4220 }
4221 //--------------------------------------------------------------------
4222
4223 return value;
4224}

4227// Returns a Color struct from hexadecimal value
4228static Color GetColor(int hexValue)
4229{
4230 Color color;
4231
4232 color.r = (unsigned char)(hexValue >> 24) & 0xFF;
4233 color.g = (unsigned char)(hexValue >> 16) & 0xFF;
4234 color.b = (unsigned char)(hexValue >> 8) & 0xFF;
4235 color.a = (unsigned char)hexValue & 0xFF;
4236
4237 return color;
4238}
4239
4240// Returns hexadecimal value for a Color
4241static int ColorToInt(Color color)
4242{
4243 return (((int)color.r << 24) | ((int)color.g << 16) | ((int)color.b << 8) | (int)color.a);
4244}

4246// Check if point is inside rectangle
4247static bool CheckCollisionPointRec(Vector2 point, Rectangle rec)
4248{
4249 bool collision = false;
4250
4251 if ((point.x >= rec.x) && (point.x <= (rec.x + rec.width)) &&
4252 (point.y >= rec.y) && (point.y <= (rec.y + rec.height))) collision = true;
4253
4254 return collision;
4255}

4257// Color fade-in or fade-out, alpha goes from 0.0f to 1.0f
4258static Color Fade(Color color, float alpha)
4259{
4260 if (alpha < 0.0f) alpha = 0.0f;
4261 else if (alpha > 1.0f) alpha = 1.0f;
4262
4263 Color result = { color.r, color.g, color.b, (unsigned char)(255.0f*alpha) };
4264
4265 return result;
4266}

4268// Formatting of text with variables to 'embed'
4269static const char *TextFormat(const char *text, ...)
4270{
4271 #if !defined(RAYGUI_TEXTFORMAT_MAX_SIZE)
4272 #define RAYGUI_TEXTFORMAT_MAX_SIZE 256
4273 #endif
4274
4275 static char buffer[RAYGUI_TEXTFORMAT_MAX_SIZE];
4276
4277 va_list args;
4278 va_start(args, text);
4279 vsprintf(buffer, text, args);
4280 va_end(args);
4281
4282 return buffer;
4283}

4292
4293// Split string into multiple strings
4294const char **TextSplit(const char *text, char delimiter, int *count)
4295{
4296 // NOTE: Current implementation returns a copy of the provided string with '\0' (string end delimiter)
4297 // inserted between strings defined by "delimiter" parameter. No memory is dynamically allocated,
4298 // all used memory is static... it has some limitations:
4299 // 1. Maximum number of possible split strings is set by RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_ITEMS
4300 // 2. Maximum size of text to split is RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_TEXT_SIZE
4301
4302 #if !defined(RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_ITEMS)
4303 #define RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_ITEMS 128
4304 #endif
4305 #if !defined(RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_TEXT_SIZE)
4306 #define RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_TEXT_SIZE 1024
4307 #endif
4308
4309 static const char *result[RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_ITEMS] = { NULL };
4310 static char buffer[RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_TEXT_SIZE] = { 0 };
4311 memset(buffer, 0, RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_TEXT_SIZE);
4312
4313 result[0] = buffer;
4314 int counter = 0;
4315
4316 if (text != NULL)
4317 {
4318 counter = 1;
4319
4320 // Count how many substrings we have on text and point to every one
4321 for (int i = 0; i < RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_TEXT_SIZE; i++)
4322 {
4323 buffer[i] = text[i];
4324 if (buffer[i] == '\0') break;
4325 else if (buffer[i] == delimiter)
4326 {
4327 buffer[i] = '\0'; // Set an end of string at this point
4328 result[counter] = buffer + i + 1;
4329 counter++;
4330
4331 if (counter == RAYGUI_TEXTSPLIT_MAX_ITEMS) break;
4332 }
4333 }
4334 }
4335
4336 *count = counter;
4337 return result;
4338}
4339
4340// Get integer value from text
4341// NOTE: This function replaces atoi() [stdlib.h]
4342static int TextToInteger(const char *text)
4343{
4344 int value = 0;
4345 int sign = 1;
4346
4347 if ((text[0] == '+') || (text[0] == '-'))
4348 {
4349 if (text[0] == '-') sign = -1;
4350 text++;
4351 }
4352
4353 for (int i = 0; ((text[i] >= '0') && (text[i] <= '9')); ++i) value = value*10 + (int)(text[i] - '0');
4354
4355 return value*sign;
4356}
4357
4358// Encode codepoint into UTF-8 text (char array size returned as parameter)
4359static const char *CodepointToUTF8(int codepoint, int *byteSize)
4360{
4361 static char utf8[6] = { 0 };
4362 int size = 0;
4363
4364 if (codepoint <= 0x7f)
4365 {
4366 utf8[0] = (char)codepoint;
4367 size = 1;
4368 }
4369 else if (codepoint <= 0x7ff)
4370 {
4371 utf8[0] = (char)(((codepoint >> 6) & 0x1f) | 0xc0);
4372 utf8[1] = (char)((codepoint & 0x3f) | 0x80);
4373 size = 2;
4374 }
4375 else if (codepoint <= 0xffff)
4376 {
4377 utf8[0] = (char)(((codepoint >> 12) & 0x0f) | 0xe0);
4378 utf8[1] = (char)(((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3f) | 0x80);
4379 utf8[2] = (char)((codepoint & 0x3f) | 0x80);
4380 size = 3;
4381 }
4382 else if (codepoint <= 0x10ffff)
4383 {
4384 utf8[0] = (char)(((codepoint >> 18) & 0x07) | 0xf0);
4385 utf8[1] = (char)(((codepoint >> 12) & 0x3f) | 0x80);
4386 utf8[2] = (char)(((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3f) | 0x80);
4387 utf8[3] = (char)((codepoint & 0x3f) | 0x80);
4388 size = 4;
4389 }
4390
4391 *byteSize = size;
4392
4393 return utf8;
4394}
4395
4396// Get next codepoint in a UTF-8 encoded text, scanning until '\0' is found
4397// When a invalid UTF-8 byte is encountered we exit as soon as possible and a '?'(0x3f) codepoint is returned
4398// Total number of bytes processed are returned as a parameter
4399// NOTE: the standard says U+FFFD should be returned in case of errors
4400// but that character is not supported by the default font in raylib
4401static int GetCodepoint(const char *text, int *bytesProcessed)
4402{
4403/*
4404 UTF-8 specs from https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3629.txt
4405
4406 Char. number range | UTF-8 octet sequence
4407 (hexadecimal) | (binary)
4408 --------------------+---------------------------------------------
4409 0000 0000-0000 007F | 0xxxxxxx
4410 0000 0080-0000 07FF | 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
4411 0000 0800-0000 FFFF | 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
4412 0001 0000-0010 FFFF | 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
4413*/
4414 // NOTE: on decode errors we return as soon as possible
4415
4416 int code = 0x3f; // Codepoint (defaults to '?')
4417 int octet = (unsigned char)(text[0]); // The first UTF8 octet
4418 *bytesProcessed = 1;
4419
4420 if (octet <= 0x7f)
4421 {
4422 // Only one octet (ASCII range x00-7F)
4423 code = text[0];
4424 }
4425 else if ((octet & 0xe0) == 0xc0)
4426 {
4427 // Two octets
4428
4429 // [0]xC2-DF [1]UTF8-tail(x80-BF)
4430 unsigned char octet1 = text[1];
4431
4432 if ((octet1 == '\0') || ((octet1 >> 6) != 2)) { *bytesProcessed = 2; return code; } // Unexpected sequence
4433
4434 if ((octet >= 0xc2) && (octet <= 0xdf))
4435 {
4436 code = ((octet & 0x1f) << 6) | (octet1 & 0x3f);
4437 *bytesProcessed = 2;
4438 }
4439 }
4440 else if ((octet & 0xf0) == 0xe0)
4441 {
4442 // Three octets
4443 unsigned char octet1 = text[1];
4444 unsigned char octet2 = '\0';
4445
4446 if ((octet1 == '\0') || ((octet1 >> 6) != 2)) { *bytesProcessed = 2; return code; } // Unexpected sequence
4447
4448 octet2 = text[2];
4449
4450 if ((octet2 == '\0') || ((octet2 >> 6) != 2)) { *bytesProcessed = 3; return code; } // Unexpected sequence
4451
4452 // [0]xE0 [1]xA0-BF [2]UTF8-tail(x80-BF)
4453 // [0]xE1-EC [1]UTF8-tail [2]UTF8-tail(x80-BF)
4454 // [0]xED [1]x80-9F [2]UTF8-tail(x80-BF)
4455 // [0]xEE-EF [1]UTF8-tail [2]UTF8-tail(x80-BF)
4456
4457 if (((octet == 0xe0) && !((octet1 >= 0xa0) && (octet1 <= 0xbf))) ||
4458 ((octet == 0xed) && !((octet1 >= 0x80) && (octet1 <= 0x9f)))) { *bytesProcessed = 2; return code; }
4459
4460 if ((octet >= 0xe0) && (0 <= 0xef))
4461 {
4462 code = ((octet & 0xf) << 12) | ((octet1 & 0x3f) << 6) | (octet2 & 0x3f);
4463 *bytesProcessed = 3;
4464 }
4465 }
4466 else if ((octet & 0xf8) == 0xf0)
4467 {
4468 // Four octets
4469 if (octet > 0xf4) return code;
4470
4471 unsigned char octet1 = text[1];
4472 unsigned char octet2 = '\0';
4473 unsigned char octet3 = '\0';
4474
4475 if ((octet1 == '\0') || ((octet1 >> 6) != 2)) { *bytesProcessed = 2; return code; } // Unexpected sequence
4476
4477 octet2 = text[2];
4478
4479 if ((octet2 == '\0') || ((octet2 >> 6) != 2)) { *bytesProcessed = 3; return code; } // Unexpected sequence
4480
4481 octet3 = text[3];
4482
4483 if ((octet3 == '\0') || ((octet3 >> 6) != 2)) { *bytesProcessed = 4; return code; } // Unexpected sequence
4484
4485 // [0]xF0 [1]x90-BF [2]UTF8-tail [3]UTF8-tail
4486 // [0]xF1-F3 [1]UTF8-tail [2]UTF8-tail [3]UTF8-tail
4487 // [0]xF4 [1]x80-8F [2]UTF8-tail [3]UTF8-tail
4488
4489 if (((octet == 0xf0) && !((octet1 >= 0x90) && (octet1 <= 0xbf))) ||
4490 ((octet == 0xf4) && !((octet1 >= 0x80) && (octet1 <= 0x8f)))) { *bytesProcessed = 2; return code; } // Unexpected sequence
4491
4492 if (octet >= 0xf0)
4493 {
4494 code = ((octet & 0x7) << 18) | ((octet1 & 0x3f) << 12) | ((octet2 & 0x3f) << 6) | (octet3 & 0x3f);
4495 *bytesProcessed = 4;
4496 }
4497 }
4498
4499 if (code > 0x10ffff) code = 0x3f; // Codepoints after U+10ffff are invalid
4500
4501 return code;
4502}
